The claim was initially published by the: but the article has since been deleted. However, a tweet from the publication still exists, stating that 40 victims of the Air India Express plane crash tested positive for coronavirus.
Purav Patel: a senior special correspondent at News Nation, also claimed that 40 passengers tested positive for COVID-19.
Alt News contacted the Malappuram Collec: s office and was informed that the claim is "fake news." This denial was also tweeted by the District Collector on August 8.
According to various sources such as the: s Office (CMO) and a PTI report, only one victim out of the at least 18 deceased tested positive for coronavirus. There are no credible news reports or official statements confirming that 40 passengers were found to be COVID positive.
